decks.notes: The deck focuses on efficiently filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, then bringing them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes control elements like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to help maintain board presence and protect the combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Mystic Forge combo by generating mana with cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal, while utilizing artifacts like Voltaic Key and Basalt Monolith to get additional value from Mystic Forge's ability. The deck also includes cards like Tezzeret, Karn, and Urza's Workshop to further support this artifact-based strategy, with additional control elements like Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern to disrupt opponents. The goal is to ultimately loop through the deck with Mystic Forge and cards like Manifold Key to generate infinite mana and win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the entire library, then use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle and win the game on the spot. The deck includes cards like Force of Will and Daze for protection, as well as Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga for card advantage and searching for key pieces. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn, catching opponents off guard with its powerful combo.

The deck focuses on using powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Entomb to cheat large creatures like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty into play quickly. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using card draw spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find combo pieces. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional card selection and card advantage, while Atraxa, Grand Unifier can help protect key combo pieces. The deck seeks to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.

The deck revolves around casting a large number of spells quickly to win the game in a single turn by milling your entire library and putting Thassa's Oracle on the battlefield to win the game. The deck uses cards that allow for quick mana acceleration, disruption of the opponent's game plan, and protection against counter spells. The goal is to assemble the necessary combo pieces in hand and cast them as efficiently as possible to achieve victory before the opponent has a chance to react.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick and devastating victory. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes versatile threats like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent and provide alternate win conditions. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and efficient spells to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to cheat big, impactful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty into play quickly. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the opponent's actions, while also featuring card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is built around dual lands like Underground Sea and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overpower the opponent with its high-powered threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by efficient removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. It also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Force of Will to control the board. The deck aims to apply early pressure on the opponent while maintaining card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble. Additionally, it includes versatile threats like Murktide Regent and True-Name Nemesis to close out games quickly. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and control.

This combo deck revolves around generating infinite mana and drawing the entire deck with Mystic Forge. By combining artifact mana ramp, untap effects, and powerful card draw engines like Mystic Forge, players can assemble a game-winning combo in a single turn. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Defense Grid and Pithing Needle to protect the combo. With the ability to tutor for the necessary pieces using Karn, the Great Creator, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful plays.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's plays through countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting their game plan. It aims to achieve this by utilizing cards like Stifle, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to maintain control of the board. Additionally, the deck also utilizes cards like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to create threats of its own and apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Lotus Petal and Urza's Saga helps to generate mana and card advantage, ensuring the deck can consistently outvalue the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize efficient and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent in combination with disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck also utilizes strong cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for key cards and control the flow of the game. The mana denial strategy with Wasteland, along with the ability to clear the board with Lightning Bolt, allows the deck to maintain tempo and control of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It then utilizes various methods to protect and support this strategy, such as counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize. The deck can quickly overwhelm opponents by bringing back big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to provide additional options and flexibility in gameplay. The goal is to efficiently reanimate creatures and outpace the opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also quickly closing out the game with aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts like Chrome Mox and The One Ring to ramp up mana quickly and potentially cast game-ending spells like Sundering Eruption. The inclusion of cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Shatterskull Smashing provide additional utility and versatility to deal with various threats.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, as well as hand disruption with Thoughtseize. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan, ultimately leading to a quick victory through the combo of reanimating high-impact creatures.

The key concept of this Dragon Stompy Legacy deck is to aggressively disrupt opponents by using powerful artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon to limit their options while quickly deploying threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Magus of the Moon and Sundering Eruption, while also generating value and card advantage with cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Urza's Saga. By locking down the opponent's resources and applying consistent pressure, this deck looks to overwhelm and outpace the opponent to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Mystic Forge and artifacts like Basalt Monolith and Grim Monolith to generate mana and cast cards from the top of the library. The deck also features cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful artifact spells and abilities, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of card advantage, mana acceleration, and board control.
